meanings.definition: Write or draw (something) carelessly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: She scribbled a quick note to her friend.
meanings.sent2: The child scribbled on the paper with colorful crayons.
meanings.sent3: The cat scribbled a secret message on the dusty shelf.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were scribbled all over his face.
meanings.sent5: The artist scribbled a masterpiece in mere minutes.

meanings.definition: Cover something with messy or illegible marks.
meanings.sent1: He scribbled all over the walls with a marker.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti artist scribbled his tag on the train car.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel scribbled acorns all over the yard.
meanings.sent4: The storm scribbled chaos across the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The ink scribbled a mysterious pattern on the ancient scroll.
